definitions.definition: (of soil or land) producing or capable of producing abundant vegetation or crops.
examples: fields along the fertile flood plains of the river

definitions.definition: (of a seed or egg) capable of becoming a new individual.
(of a person, animal, or plant) able to conceive young or produce seed.
examples: Barbara carefully calculated the period when she was most fertile
synonyms: able to have children; technicalfecund "fertile couples"

definitions.definition: (of a person's mind or imagination) producing many new and inventive ideas with ease.
examples: imaginative, inventive, innovative, creative, visionary, original, ingenious; Moreproductive, prolific "a fertile brain"Moreproductive, prolific a fertile brain

definitions.definition: (of a situation or subject) fruitful and productive in generating new ideas.
examples: a series of fertile debates within the social sciences

definitions.definition: (of nuclear material) able to become fissile by the capture of neutrons.
